content: In the following questions, I will provide a target Python program code. The code is a program containing a loop, and the purpose of the code is indicated by its function name. Please provide a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop to prove the partial correctness of the program. The loop invariant should be written in the form 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])'. (Please note that your answer should only contain statements in the specified format without any additional text.)

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the `find_max` function is:

`max_value_value = find_max(arr[i]->arr[i])`

This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is updated correctly in each iteration of the loop. It proves that the function correctly finds the maximum value in the array `arr`.

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the `find_max` function is:

`max_value_value = find_max(arr[i]->arr[-1])`

This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is updated correctly in each iteration of the loop. It proves that the function correctly finds the maximum value in the array `arr` by comparing the current element with the last element of the array.
